metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16927 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: The scp_v0s_accept function in sesman/libscp/libscp_v0.c in the sessionmanager in xrdp through 0.9.4 uses an untrusted integer as a write length,which allows local users to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow andapplication crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a craftedinput stream.

criterions.comment: xrdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
